title: Anne Michaels receives 2 nominations for 2019 Vine Awards for Jewish Canadian literature | CBC Books
text:
Anne Michaels has received two nominations — one for her poetry collection All We Saw and one for her nonfiction book Infinite Gradation — for the 2019 Vine Awards.

The Vine Awards honour the best Canadian literature by Jewish writers or on Jewish subjects. There are five categories and each comes with a grand prize of $10,000.

Sarah Weinman joins Michaels on the nonfiction shortlist for her book The Real Lolita, an investigation into the abduction of a young American girl that inspired Vladimir Nabokov's notorious and revered novel.

Jonathan Auxier is nominated in the children's/young adult category for Sweep, a historical novel about a young chimney sweep who is protected by a golem made from ash and coal. The book is also nominated for the 2019 TD Canadian Children's Literature Award and won the 2018 Governor General's Literary Award for nonfiction.

Claire Holden Rothman is a finalist of the fiction category for Lear's Shadow. The novel follows a woman named Bea Rose who, after splitting with her partner and business, joins the backstage crew of an outdoor production of King Lear.

This year's jury — comprised of Ayesha Chatterjee, Melanie J. Fishbane and Eric Beck Rubin — chose the shortlisted books from 84 entries.

The Vine Awards winners will be announced on Oct. 23, 2019.
